column4: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=205449  Down near the bottom (search for "how to get AC'97") is the boat I'm in, yet I staill can't get sound out my speakers.  ANyone heard anything else on trouble getting (this is aplay-l output) card 0: V8237 [VIA 8237], device 0: VIA 8237 [VIA 8237] wotking?
in the volume applet, try tinkering with the output device selections
how do I know when the change "takes"?  As soon as i make the selection, after closign the app, or do I have to reboot?
keep something running that makes sound and change it, no reboot needed
you're talking about the hardware, or output tab in the volume control app?
do you have the latest kernel updates? sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
if a new kernel was installed (linux-image package) reboot and try again, if not, try installing linux-backports-modules-alsa-lucid-generic and reboot

ok, everything is updated, installed linux-backports-modules-alsa-lucid-generic, and still no sound.  I can go into alsa and monkey with all the faders, but there's no sound coming out of any hole on the card
there are a couple of bugs filed on that card but no comments whatsoever
huh...  Used to work in gutsy; that's odd
hey there; I've got sound now.  Threw in a new card, disabled the old one in BIOS...  Now sound is choppy though, after a couple of seconds
things like system sounds play fine though (they're short)
uninstall the backports package and try
I did that before I came in
